result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse C. Arndt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentence to commence forthwith

FURLOUGH REQUEST - GRANTED
Faxed to Columbia County and response from Columbia County DA & Hon. AJW
Court Appointed Attorney billing
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Jesse C. Arndt in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that there is a joint recommendation to the court and states the agreement.  The defendant has been sentenced in Columbia County.  Atty Frank agrees with the joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions:
*6 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
Report Forthwith
Court gives 48 hours for the defendant to report to Probation
*Court Costs = $268.00
*DNA Sample (if not done so already) + $250.00 Surcharge
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Sentencing hearing at 03-16-2016 03:15 pm

Defendant Jesse C. Arndt in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement and Atty Frank will be asking for a sentencing date.  Atty Frank states that the defendant will be going into custody in Columbia County on March 11th.
Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.
Set for Sentencing.

Atty Frank waives a PSI.
Atty Hendee waives a PSI.
BY THE COURT:  PSI waived by both counsel.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Jesse C. Arndt in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Frank; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Frank agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Frank states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.
Atty Frank enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.
  Return date scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jesse C. Arndt in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Frank; he will be withdrawing from the case.  Court received a letter from Atty Frank requesting the withdrawal.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the withdrawal by Atty Frank.  Defendant would like a court appointed Attorney and has filled out the paperwork and gives it to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court approves the paperwork and appoints Attorney Ryan Frank.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in April.
bond continued.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.
letter from Atty requesting to be withdrawn
Preliminary hearing on February 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant states that he has retained Atty Frank.  Atty Frank is now appears with the defendant.
Atty Hendee states that since the defendant just retained Atty Frank; Discovery will be provided and asks that this be reset.
Atty Frank agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
Time limits have been waived.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.

with conditions:

Defendant Jesse C. Arndt in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  
Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.  Defendant asks to do the booking when he comes back to jail at 5:00pm.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

Defendant waives time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant is working on getting an Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 11:00 am.
